column3: There's an open issue, #4071, suggesting porting certain tests over, and it seemed like a decent way to get familiar with the subject matter as a new contributor.   \n

Nice. Yes, one of the goals is to port the tests to Python, so that a) they're written in a common language b) theyre not just a bunch of hacky shell scripts that fail on half the machines due to silly path problems.\n
Could these comments be put into a docstring instead? Importing the file will then reveal these comments in `__doc__`.\n

nit: line 40 is not very pep8-friendly (even if spacing here is not explicitly defined in pep8). But flake8 or some other pep8-compatible linter isn't being used yet anyway, so you could probably get away this....\n

Regarding print statements, two thoughts come to mind:

1) Use `print()` so that the file is python3-compatible. I think this will be the only required change, so it's an easy win.

2) An alternative is to not use print at all, and instead use `import logging` and then enable logging to stdout: https://docs.python.org/3/howto/logging.html
Please use 'python2' explicitly, we've recently changed this for all tests\n
